exceptions.exn: In environment φ, ν : nat -> nat k, n : nat Unable to unify "match n with | 0 => φ k | S x => ν x end" with "match match n with | 0 => dee_var k | S i => dee_par i end with | dee_nat n => n | dee_var v => φ v | dee_par i => ν i | dee_comp o v w => de_op_sem o (φ v) (φ w) end".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
ν: nat -> nat
φ: nat -> nat
k: nat
e: dio_elem_expr

Goal:
dee_eval φ ν (dee_dec k e) = dee_eval φ (fun x : nat => match x with | 0 => φ k | S x0 => ν x0 end) e

Premises:
dee_dec = fun (k : nat) (e : dio_elem_expr) => match e with | dee_nat n => dee_nat n | dee_var v => dee_var v | dee_par 0 => dee_var k | dee_par (S i) => dee_par i | dee_comp o v w => dee_comp o v w end : nat -> dio_elem_expr -> dio_elem_expr Arguments dee_dec _%nat_scope
dee_eval = fun (φ ν : nat -> nat) (e : dio_elem_expr) => match e with | dee_nat n => n | dee_var v => φ v | dee_par i => ν i | dee_comp o v w => de_op_sem o (φ v) (φ w) end : (nat -> nat) -> (nat -> nat) -> dio_elem_expr -> nat Arguments dee_eval (_ _)%function_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Inductive dio_elem_expr : Set := dee_nat : nat -> dio_elem_expr | dee_var : nat -> dio_elem_expr | dee_par : nat -> dio_elem_expr | dee_comp : dio_op -> nat -> nat -> dio_elem_expr Arguments dee_nat _%nat_scope Arguments dee_var _%nat_scope Arguments dee_par _%nat_scope Arguments dee_comp _ (_ _)%nat_scope
der_lift = fun (ρ : nat -> nat) (x : nat) => match x with | 0 => 0 | S x0 => S (ρ x0) end : (nat -> nat) -> nat -> nat Arguments der_lift _%function_scope _%nat_scope
dio_rel_cst : forall x n : nat, 𝔻R (fun ν : nat -> nat => ν x = n)
dio_rel_exst : forall K : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop, 𝔻R (fun ν : nat -> nat => K (ν 0) ν⭳) -> 𝔻R (fun ν : nat -> nat => exists x : nat, K x ν)
BinNatDef.N.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.N0 | S n' => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n') end : nat -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.of_nat _%nat_scope
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.Z0 | S n0 => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope
dee_vars = fun (e : dio_elem_expr) (x : nat) => match e with | dee_var v => x = v | dee_comp _ v w => x = v \/ x = w | _ => False end : dio_elem_expr -> nat -> Prop Arguments dee_vars _ _%nat_scope
gcd.divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gcd.divides (_ _)%nat_scope
gcd.is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => gcd.divides r p /\ gcd.divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, gcd.divides k p -> gcd.divides k q -> gcd.divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gcd.is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
dio_rel_True = dio_rel_equiv (fun _ : nat -> nat => True) dio_rel_True_subproof (dio_rel_exst (fun (x : nat) (_ : nat -> nat) => x = 0) (dio_rel_cst 0 0)) : 𝔻R (fun _ : nat -> nat => True)
dee_eval_ext : forall (e : dio_elem_expr) (φ1 ν1 φ2 ν2 : nat -> nat), (forall x : nat, dee_vars e x -> φ1 x = φ2 x) -> (forall x : nat, ν1 x = ν2 x) -> dee_eval φ1 ν1 e = dee_eval φ2 ν2 e
de_op_sem = fun o : dio_op => match o with | do_add => Init.Nat.add | do_mul => Init.Nat.mul end : dio_op -> nat -> nat -> nat Arguments de_op_sem _ (_ _)%nat_scope
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => y | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.mul_wd_obligation_1 = fun (x y : nat) (H : x = y) (x0 y0 : nat) (H0 : x0 = y0) => eq_ind_r (fun x1 : nat => x * x1 = y * y0) (eq_ind_r (fun x1 : nat => x1 * y0 = y * y0) eq_refl H) H0 : Morphisms.respectful eq (Morphisms.respectful eq eq) Init.Nat.mul Init.Nat.mul
BinNatDef.N.to_nat = fun a : BinNums.N => match a with | BinNums.N0 => 0 | BinNums.Npos p => BinPos.Pos.to_nat p end : BinNums.N -> nat Arguments BinNatDef.N.to_nat _%N_scope
BinIntDef.Z.to_nat = fun z : BinNums.Z => match z with | BinNums.Zpos p => BinPos.Pos.to_nat p | _ => 0 end : BinNums.Z -> nat Arguments BinIntDef.Z.to_nat _%Z_scope

BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
df_size = fix df_size (f : dio_formula) : nat := match f with | df_op _ _ _ _ => 5 | df_bin _ f0 g => 1 + df_size f0 + df_size g | ∃ f0 => 1 + df_size f0 | _ => 3 end : dio_formula -> nat
df_ren = fix df_ren (ρ : nat -> nat) (f : dio_formula) {struct f} : dio_formula := match f with | df_cst x n => df_cst (ρ x) n | df_eq x y => df_eq (ρ x) (ρ y) | df_op o x y z => df_op o (ρ x) (ρ y) (ρ z) | df_bin o f0 g => df_bin o (df_ren ρ f0) (df_ren ρ g) | ∃ f0 => ∃ df_ren (der_lift ρ) f0 end : (nat -> nat) -> dio_formula -> dio_formula Arguments df_ren _%function_scope
dio_rel_equiv : forall R S : (nat -> nat) -> Prop, (forall ν : nat -> nat, S ν <-> R ν) -> 𝔻R R -> 𝔻R S
Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope

BinNatDef.N.div_eucl = fun a b : BinNums.N => match a with | BinNums.N0 => (BinNums.N0, BinNums.N0) | BinNums.Npos na => match b with | BinNums.N0 => (BinNums.N0, a) | BinNums.Npos _ => BinNatDef.N.pos_div_eucl na b end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N * BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.div_eucl (_ _)%N_scope

BinIntDef.Z.of_N = fun n : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Npos p => BinNums.Zpos p end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_N _%N_scope
